page.title: 19Flemish Farm Windsor
page.content: On Monday 10th June we visited{Flemish {Farm}in Windsor Gt. Park. The farm was built in 1880 and was named after a favourite Royal dog. For many years the buildings were used for hens and later became derelict. Today the farm buildings are just used to accommodate{Polo Ponies}for {'Guards' Polo Club.}There are over ninety horses, some of them costing up to Â£16000. The best polo ponies are imported from Argentina. This is a very expensive sport since a club polo player may need four horses. The farm employs a manager and up to 23 staff. Most of them are girls who work from 6.30a.m. until 8.30p.m. as grooms. At 16yrs. they are paid Â£45. Flemish Farm is not a typical farm but is located in{Windsor Gt. Park}as Polo is regularly played at Smiths Lawn by {Prince Charles.
